result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance Corey Clay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Complete a Batterers Intervention Program.
Mental health assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Agent may order absolute sobriety if appropriate.

No use or possession of firearms.
No contact with victim.
Full time work, school or  a combination.

Provide a DNA sample.
Pay the domestic abuse assessment fee.
Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges including DNA and DV during period of probation. If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
-Court waives all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lance Corey Clay

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lance Corey Clay appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Lance Corey Clay.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
BRANCH 1 FOR BRANCH 41.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition. 
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Court finds victim notification has been complied with.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant ordered to serve 9 MONTHS concurrent in the House of Correction, credit of 91 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant ordered to serve 90 DAYS concurrent in the House of Correction, credit of 91 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

- Complete a batters intervention program.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Agent may order absolute sobriety if appropriate. 
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- No contact with victim.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.


- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.  Case is adjourned to Br. 41.
Review hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Court is in Jury Trial and unable to hear this case.  Case spun to Judge Davila, Br. 1.  Parties notified by email.
Received and Filed. Jury Instructions - Disorderly Conduct
Received and Filed. Jury instructions- Battery
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Defendant Lance Corey Clay appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Lance Corey Clay.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Further, defense informs court that they are now in a resolution posture. Case adjourned to Br 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Lance Corey Clay not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Lance Corey Clay.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel has just received an offer and requests additional time to meet with defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Court is in trial on another case and is unable to proceed on this matter. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with AMC
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lance Corey Clay in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Lance Corey Clay in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  
This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
